bitfield.description: The start flag of the IPIPE module. When EN is 1, the IPIPE module starts a processing from the next rising edge of the VD. If the processing mode of the IPIPE module is one shot, the EN is cleared to 0 immediately after the processing has started.
The mode selection of the ipipeif_wrt which is an input port of the IPIPE module. If WRT is 0, the IPIPE module does not use the ipipeif_wrt. Else the IPIPE module uses it.
The processing mode selection of the IPIPE module. Value 0 indicates the mode of free run, value 1 indicates the mode of one shot.
IPIPE module data path selection

bitenum.description: IN: RAW BAYER OUT: YUV4:2:2 Note that the IPIPE YUV4:2:2 output goes to the RESIZER module where it can be further be converted in YUV4:2:0 or RGB format.
IN: RAW BAYER OUT: RAW BAYER The data are output after the White Balance module. It enables to bypass a large part of the IPIPE module.
IN: YUV4:2:2 OUT: YUV4:2:2 Note that the IPIPE YUV4:2:2 output goes to the RESIZER module where it can be further be converted in YUV4:2:0 or RGB format.
IN: RAW BAYER OUT: DISABLED The data are only going to BOXCAR and HISTOGRAM modules.

bitfield.description: The color pattern of the odd line and odd pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The color pattern of the odd line and even pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The color pattern of the even line and odd pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The color pattern of the even line and even pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The vertical position of the global frame from the rising edge of the VD. The IPIPE module will start an image processing from VAL line.
The vertical size of the processing area. The VAL0 can not be written. The IPIPE module will process (VAL+1) lines.
The horizontal position of the global frame from the rising edge of the HD. The IPIPE module will start an image processing from VAL clock.
The horizontal size of the processing area. The VAL0 is fixed. The IPIPE module processes (VAL+1) clocks.
This is the LSB of the VAL[12:0]. This bit is read only.
EDOF port selection This bit must not be enabled since the EDOF module is not implemented. This is a provision for a future revision of the IP.
Status of Histogram Process (busy status).
Status of Histogram bank select.
Status of BSC process (busy status).
Status of Boxcar process (busy status).

Status of Boxcar process (error status). This bit will be triggered when an overflow happens while transferring the boxcar data to memory. Instead of polling for this register, it is preferable to use the IPIPE_BOXCAR_OVF interrupt. Overflow errors are non recoverable at ISP level and require a software reset at ISS level.
The on/off selection of the clk_arm_g0 which is used for some ARM register access.
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g3 which is use for the IPIPE processes of EE .
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g2 which is use for the IPIPE processes ofRGB2RGB blending to '422', 'Histogram(YCbCr input)'.
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g1 which is used for the IPIPE processes of 'DefectCorrection' to 'WhiteBalance', and 'Histogram(RAW input)'.
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g0 which is used for the IPIPE processing of 'Boxcar'.
Enable of LUT defect pixel correction.
LUT table type selection.
Replace dot selection on processing method 0.
The address of the first valid data in look-up-table
The number of valid data in look-up-table. (SIZ+1)

The output offset value for Y
The output offset value for Cb For Cb/Cr, set (0x80 + offset value) here. (0x80 for zero offset.)

register.description: YUV4:2:2 down sampling register. This register controls the YUV4:4:4 to YUV4:2:2 chroma downsampling. This register is valid if .FMT = 0 (RAW input and YUV output). = 0 leads to pure subsampling, no filtering, cosited chroma output. = 1 leads to (1, 1) >> 1 filtering, centered chroma output. = 2 leads to (1, 2, 1) >> 1 filtering, cosited chroma output. = 3 leads to (1, 3, 3, 1) >> 3 filtering, centered chroma output. When the chroma output is cosited, and that downsampling is enabled in the RESIZER module, one need to take care that the averager disrupts the relative phase for luma and chroma color components. The and registers need to be used to fix the disruption.

bitfield.description: 121-LPF enable for chrominance samples. This register is valid if IPIPE_SRC_FMT.FMT = 0 (RAW input and YUV output).

This bit sets the output position of the chrominance sample with regards to the luma sample positions. One can choose between centered and cosited. This register is valid if IPIPE_SRC_FMT.FMT = 0 (RAW input and YUV output). The RESIZER module does not change the relative position of the chroma samples vs. the luma samples between the input and output and the chroma position at the output of the IPIPE module and at the output of the RESIZER module must be identical. In other words, we must have RSZ_YUV_PHS.POS = IPIPE_YUV_PHS.POS.
The on/off selection of the Edge enhancer.
Halo reduction in Edge Sharpener module
Merging method between Edge Enhancer and Edge Sharpener
Down shift length of high pass filter (HPF) in edge enhancer.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.
Multiplier coefficient in HPF.

Edge Enhancer lower threshold before referring to LUT. If HPF &lt;IPIPE_YEE_THR -&gt; output is HPF + IPIPE_YEE_THR If HPF &gt;IPIPE_YEE_THR -&gt; output is HPF - IPIPE_YEE_THR Otherwise, output is zero.
Edge sharpener gain
Edge sharpener HPF value lower limit
Edge sharpener HPF value upper limit (after 6 bit right shift)
Edge sharpener, gain value on gradient
Edge sharpener, offset value on gradient
This bit enables or disables the BOXCAR functionality. The BOXCAR output is written to SDRAM. One need to set the IPIPE_BOX_SDR_SAD_H and IPIPE_BOX_SDR_SAD_L registers with the appropriate address.
The processing mode selection of the Boxcar function. A 0 indicates the mode of the free run, a 1 indicates the mode of the one shot.
Block size in boxcar sampling
The down shift value applied to the boxcar computation result. R out = SUM (Rij) &gt;&gt; SHF G out = (SUM (Gr ij)/2 + SUM (Gr ij)/2) &gt;&gt; SHF B out = SUM (Gij) &gt;&gt; SHF
The higher 11 bits of the first address of output in memory.
The lower 16 bits of the first address of output in memory.
Ensures 32-byte alignment.

This bit enables or disables the HISTOGRAM functionality. When enabled, the HISTOGRAM computation will start the processing from the next rising edge of the VD pulse. If the processing mode of the HISTOGRAM is one shot, the enable bit will be cleared to 0 immediately after the processing has started.
The processing mode selection of the Histogram module. A 0 indicates the mode of the free run, a 1 indicates the mode of the one shot.
Input selection. When SEL0=0, RGBY are sampled from the output of the line buffer in noise filter-2. When SEL0=1, YCbCr are sampled at the output of RGB2YCbCr module. Y is sampled twice.
G selection in Bayer mode (SEL0=0)

register.description: Histogram COL0, COL1, COL2, and COL3 should be set to 1.

bitfield.description: The number of the bins.
The shift length of the input data. data = (INPUT &gt;&gt; SHF)

Histogram memory clear. The histogram can be cleared before the start of operations. However, the clear takes 512 cycles and therefore: + if line size &gt; 512, the first line must not be used for histogram computation. + if line size &lt; 512, ceil (512/line size) lines must not be used for histogram computation. It's the programmer's responsibility to set the histogram computation area outside the 'clear' area.

This bit must be used to select which memory is used to store the histogram data. By selecting alternatively one or the other bit, one can double buffer the histogram output buffer. The 4-KiB memory can either be read by the CPU or a DMA request.

bitenum.description: Use Table 0 and 1 = 4 KiB in the memory ISP map.
Use Table 2 and 3 = 4 KiB in the memory ISP map.
